title: Streaming Non-Autoregressive Model for Accent Conversion and Pronunciation Improvement
author: Tuan-Nam Nguyen (Karlsruhe Institute of Technology), Ngoc-Quan Pham (Karlsruhe Institute of Technology), S¸eymanur Akti (Karlsruhe Institute of Technology), Alexander Waibel (Karlsruhe Institute of Technology, Carnegie Mellon University), ...
relevance_why: The paper presents a streaming accent conversion model that could enhance real-time speech applications relevant to Haohe Liu's focus on audio processing and enhancement.
background: Accent conversion models aim to modify non-native speech into a native-like accent in real-time, which is essential for improving communication across languages.
contribution: This paper introduces a streaming accent conversion model to solve the challenge of real-time audio processing, achieving high-quality audio synthesis while maintaining speaker identity and prosody.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods primarily focused on non-streaming approaches that processed complete utterances, making them unsuitable for real-time applications.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work modifies a non-streaming model for incremental processing, leveraging an Emformer architecture and optimized inference for streaming capabilities.

key_innovation: Transforms speech in real-time, maintaining audio quality and speaker characteristics through an innovative incremental processing framework.
real_world_impact: This model can significantly enhance applications in video conferencing and language learning by providing seamless accent conversion, potentially improving communication effectiveness across diverse speakers.
limitations: The latency of 0.8s is not yet ideal for low-latency needs in dynamic settings.

new_terms.Emformer: **Emformer** is a type of Transformer architecture optimized for low-latency streaming applications, utilizing an efficient attention mechanism.
new_terms.bottleneck extractor: **Bottleneck extractor** refers to a model component that identifies and eliminates unwanted features, such as accent attributes, to improve pronunciation in speech conversion.

open_sourcing: The authors have provided implementation source code for streaming inference.
